contextId.occurrenceNote: The people betraying Yahweh and worshiping other gods is spoken of as if the people were prostitutes. Alternate translation: "betrayed him by worshiping false gods" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: gave themselves like prostitutes to other gods and worshiped them

contextId.occurrenceNote: The people of Israel wish to be like the sun that rises because no nation's army is powerful enough to stop the sunrise. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: like the sun when it rises in its might

contextId.occurrenceNote: The Midianites are compared to a swarm of locusts because they came in with a great number of people and their livestock ate everything that grew. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: they would come as a swarm of locusts

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "cloud" means a swarm. The author speaks of the army as if it were a swarm of locusts to emphasize how many soldiers there were. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: as thick as a cloud of locusts

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "terrible" means "frightening." Alternate translation: "I was very afraid of him because he looked like an angel of God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: his appearance was like that of an angel of God, very terrible

contextId.occurrenceNote: Samson easily broken the ropes that bound his hands. The author describes how easily he broke the ropes by saying it was as if they had become burnt flax. Alternate translation: "He snapped the ropes on his arms as easily as if they had been stalks of burned flax" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: The ropes on his arms became like burnt flax

contextId.occurrenceNote: The author describes how easily he broke the bowstrings by comparing them to how yarn breaks when it is burned. Alternate translation: "he broke the bowstrings as easily as if he were breaking burned yarn" or "he broke the bowstrings as easily as if they were made of thin yarn" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: he broke the bowstrings like a thread of yarn when it touches the fire

contextId.occurrenceNote: The author describes how easily Samson broke the ropes by comparing it to him breaking a piece of thread. Alternate translation: "as easily as if they were only a piece of thread" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: like they were a piece of thread

contextId.occurrenceNote: The relationship between the Levite and Micah became like the close relationship between a father and son. Alternate translation: "the young man became close to Micah and was like one of his sons" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: the young man became to Micah like one of his sons

contextId.occurrenceNote: This simile speaks of the group as acting as a single person. It refers to a group of who people do everything together in the same way. Alternate translation: "as if they were a single man" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])

This simile speaks of the group as acting as a single person. They all acted together in exactly the same way. Alternate translation: "as if they were a single man" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
